intro: My housefolk got a dog recently.
I miss them, but, wow... I'm glad I don't have to deal with that.
How curious... a creature, roaming these rooted confinements.
Do not be afraid, your fear will not aid you. I had to learn that the hard way, alone.
It seems you are lost in more ways than one.
As am I, I suppose we have that much in common. Lucky you.
You can run as much as you'd like.
In time, the trees will start to whisper misguidance to you.
Then, you will never find your way home.
I've seen wondrous lands, even whilst alone and afraid.
It makes me bitter, you know. Knowing all that is out there...
Yet, the place I was supposed to call home is the same that drags me here.
You can't trust anyone, I learnt that out there.
You shouldn't even trust me..
How awful must I have been, to end up in the hell for a belief that I didn't even hold?
[t_c chuckles.]
Guess I'd better start learning some of this 'Clan' stuff. Hey, wanna teach me?
Do you have a family, little one?
Oh... you're one of them. I'm glad you have someone to look out for you.
[t_c visibly flinches when {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/see/sees} you, {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} wispy, otherworldly pelt shaking.]
Oh- a Clancat! I didn't know I was on your territory... or that you could see me.
[The kittypet seems to disappear into mist in front of you. You can't help but wonder where {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/go/goes}.]
Look, look! t_m!
I told you that {PRONOUN/y_c/subject} {VERB/y_c/were/was} safe, even when {PRONOUN/t_c/subject}{VERB/t_c/'re/'s} so far away...
Now what did those nice cats name you again? y_c? Strange... but beautiful.
Just like you, my kit.
Eep!
[t_c startles when you approach, the cat crouching a bit as {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/cower/cowers} away from you.]
[You assure the kittypet that you won't hurt {PRONOUN/t_c/object}.]
Really? Isn't that what you 'Clan' cats do? I thought you all hated housecats...
[You bring up the fact it doesn't make much sense to chase off a cat that's already dead.]
You're right, I suppose. Sometimes I swear others can see me, too, though. Not everycat is so kind... thank you, but I should leave.
[You give t_c a light wave of your tail as {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/disappear/disappears} into the horizon beyond, {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} wispy shape fading into nothing but a pale glow.]
[You go out for a hunting trip, and upon a rock, basking in the early morning sunlight, sits a spirit, purring contently.]
[You move closer, and {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/tilt/tilts} {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} head just enough to catch a glimpse of you, yawning.]
Isn't this weather wonderful?
You wouldn't believe how hard it is to feel warm like this anymore.
You should join me, while you can still enjoy it to its fullest.

[After a moment, you clamber up onto the rock, pressing yourself close to the ghostly cat. {PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/t_c/purr/purrs}, shifting {PRONOUN/t_c/self} aside to give you the full ray of sun.]
[It really is wonderful.]
You know, the way you Clan cats live your lives is... interesting.
Why not just find some housefolk? They're very nice, and you can enjoy all sorts of things, like warm blankets, free food, and all the cuddles you want.
Why are you making that face?
Hi! Um, I think I lost my housefolk. You wouldn't know where they are, would you?
Oh, housefolk are, like, these big cats with no fur, and they walk on their back paws, and they have these big warm dens full of lots of stuff!
Mine are very nice. They were very happy to have me, I just don't know where they went...
[You tell the kit that you're sorry, but you don't think you can help {PRONOUN/t_c/object}.]
Oh, okay, that's fine. I'll keep looking.
[You find t_c near the Clan border, staring off into the trees.]
Oh! Hi, y_c. I'm just... looking.
I lost my housefolk forever ago, and I feel like I'll never find them, when I look at how big the world is.
Do you think they're around here, somewhere? They must be so sad without me...
y_c! y_c! Look, look, look!
[As soon as {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/catch/catches} sight of you, t_c turns and sprints away. You run to catch up, almost losing {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} translucent pelt in the scenery.]
[{PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/t_c/stop/stops} short of a weird hole in the ground and {VERB/t_c/point/points} to it.]
Here! Look! It's a pawprint from some housefolk! There's a bunch of them! They came from this way!
They don't smell familiar, but, maybe they're from my housefolk, and they've finally come looking for me!
[You ensure t_c that, yes, maybe that's true, and at the same time, make a mental note to inform the rest of the Clan about Twolegs on the territory.]
[t_c is watching the Thunderpath.]
Sometimes I just sit here and make sure that the cars don't hit any cats.
They're usually pretty smart and slow down when they see anyone crossing the road... but I watch just in case.
[You don't understand most of the words that t_c is meowing.]
[You see a curious t_c peeking {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} head over the border. With a graceful leap, {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} misty paws hit the star-littered ground.]
Oh! Hello there!
Jee, you Clan cats are less scary than I thought you were.
Sad that I only figured that out once... you know...

[You offer the kittypet to hunt with you in StarClan for a while, and {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} cautiously {VERB/t_c/accept/accepts}, allowing you to show {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} the ropes. After a few catches, {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/return/returs} to {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} side of the border.]
Thank you, y_c! I had a lovely time, but I have to go back to watching over my housefolk. They still need me.
Mewwww...
[Oh! A tiny kittypet kit has wandered to the border you were playing at.]
Mew? Mew!

[{PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/t_c/toddle/toddles} as fast as {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} can to your side and {VERB/t_c/cuddle/cuddles} in. Maybe {PRONOUN/t_c/subject}{VERB/t_c/'re/'s} not a StarClan cat... But you can give {PRONOUN/t_c/object} some company!]
[t_c drifts to sleep. Soon enough, so do you. When a queen finds you all alone later you don't mention the strange little visitor.]
[You're retrieving a moss-ball from near the border when you notice a newborn kittypet kit with transparent, misty fur that waves softly.]
Mew?
Mew mew!

[{PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/t_c/bap/baps} the mossball with a teeny tiny paw! Though {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} can't play properly, you invite t_c to join you and your friends for a bit. {PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP}{VERB/t_c/'re/'s} content with company.]
[It's sad to see {PRONOUN/t_c/object} go later.]
[t_c approaches you, tail high and eyes bright.]
Hi! What are you doing here? Are you lost?
[It feels so strange to talk to a cat who isn't immediately hostile towards you. You aren't even sure how to respond.]
What's on my agenda today... Hm...
Well, I was going to go visit my housefolk, see how they're doing. I think they've been lonely without me bothering them all day, haha! Someone's got to take care of them.
After that, I'll go say hi to the kits, and take a nap by the old oak. Or maybe I should go to the river instead? What do you think? I like the oak better but-
[You growl for this kittypet to just stop talking, but {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/ignore/ignores} you and {VERB/t_c/continue/continues} rambling on.]
I think I'm struggling a bit without the Twolegs that took care of me.
I like to visit them sometimes... I know they can't see me but I'm at peace just watching them go about their lives.
Hello y_c!
Have you seen the new housefolk that moved in to your old home?
They brought a kitten with them!
